meanings.definition: To cut off (a limb), especially by surgery.
meanings.sent1: The doctor amputates the injured leg to save the patient's life.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon amputates the arm to prevent the spread of infection.
meanings.sent3: When the robot mistakenly amputates the wrong part, it becomes a comedy of errors.
meanings.sent4: In times of war, soldiers may feel like the enemy amputates their sense of safety.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the bone being amputated echoed through the operating room.

meanings.definition: To remove by or as if by cutting off.
meanings.sent1: The gardener amputates the dead branches from the tree to promote growth.
meanings.sent2: The tailor amputates the excess fabric to perfect the fit of the dress.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally amputates a chunk of the cake while trying to slice it.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to leave the toxic relationship amputates negativity from her life.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor amputates pieces of clay to reveal the hidden masterpiece within.
